description:
The Director of Sponsorship Revenue is responsible for developing a diverse and sustainable local funding foundation to achieve the funding growth necessary to support KC2026 while ensuring consistent, positive messaging to the public for affiliate programs.

Due to the nature of this role, we will identify the subject matter expert who will exceed the full responsibilities of this position.

Essential Functions & Competencies
• Develop and lead organizational fundraising strategy and implementation plan to achieve KC2026 revenue goals with a focus on sponsorship, merchandise and other ancillary revenue streams. Identify and secure high-value partnerships and sponsorships by creating compelling value propositions, negotiating contracts, managing activation and building strong relationships with sponsors and partners.
• Manage a portfolio of high-net-worth donors and prospects, developing and implementing a tailored strategy, solicitation, and stewardship plans.
• Evaluate progress toward goals and provide regular reporting to KC2026 Executive Commitee.
• Establish systems, processes, and tools to maximize fundraising capacity including overseeing donor management system.
• Work closely with cross-functional teams including (but not limited to) Marketing & Communications, Community Engagement and Host City Operations to ensure seamless integration of revenue-generating activities within the overall event strategy.
• Coordinate fund raising special events.
• Maintain gift recognition policies.
• Perform other related duties as requested.

Required Qualifications
• Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience.
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Non-Profit Management or Business Administration.
• Robust knowledge of fundraising principles.
• Innovative and results oriented with a focus on achieving revenue goals and maximizing profitability
• Expertise in cultivation and solicitation for all levels of giving.
• Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to write compelling donor communications.
• Experience in revenue management and sponsorship development for large scale sports & entertainment events preferred.

KC2026 is the 501(c)(4) non-profit entity that has been incorporated to lead the strategy for the planning and activation of the FIFA World Cup 26™ in Kansas City. KC2026 is governed by a Board of Directors comprised of elected/appointed officials, representatives from the local professional sports teams and key community leaders. The purpose of the entity is to maximize the positive momentum created by FIFA World Cup 26™ to unite, strengthen, and elevate our region while propelling Kansas City to new heights in the nation and the world.
